channel.title: Pedro Alcàcer - Lutenist
channel.description: Recent content on Pedro Alcàcer - Lutenist

item.description:
Arlecchino innamorato

A theatrical musical program bringing to life the commedia dell’arte character of Harlequin in love.

Ensemble Members:

  • Valentina Mastrangelo - Soprano
  • Giampaolo Fagotto - Tenor (Arlecchino)
  • Pedro Alcàcer Doria - Theorbo and Baroque Guitar
  • Marco Mencoboni - Harpsichord and Musical Direction

Les musiques du Roi Soleil

Music from the court of Louis XIV, the Sun King, featuring the intimate sound of viols and theorbo.

Ensemble Members:

  • Juan Manuel Quintana - Viola da gamba
  • Victor Aragón - Viola da gamba
  • Pedro Alcàcer Doria - Theorbo

Una storia fra le corde…

Vihuela and Theorbo

“A story among the strings” - this program weaves together narratives through the intimate sound of the vihuela and the resonant depths of the theorbo. Spanning from the Spanish Golden Age to the Italian Baroque, the program tells musical stories of love, devotion, and human experience.

Repertoire Themes

  • Spanish Golden Age vihuela music
  • Italian theorbo works
  • Narrative and descriptive pieces

Tanyer de gala

Vihuela and Baroque Guitar

item.title: Anima Shirvani
item.description:
See details and repertoire in the ensemble programme PDF (if available) or contact for booking.

Anima Shirvani is an ensemble program combining Renaissance textures with Eastern timbres.

item.title: Arlecchino innamorato
item.description: Theatrical ensemble programme centred on the character Arlecchino.

item.title: Bologna liutistica
item.description:
Download the original program PDF: Download PDF

Bologna liutistica

Renaissance lute and Theorbo

Lute

  • 3 Fantasie — Francesco Canova da Milano (Intavolatura di Lauto, Venice 1546)
  • Passacaglia — Alessandro Piccinini (Bologna 1623)
  • O dulx Roveoir / Ballo Allemano — Giovanni Antonio Terzi (Intavolatura di liuto, Venice 1593)

Theorbo / Chitarrone

  • Arpeggiata
  • Toccata prima
  • Works by Giovanni Girolamo Kapsperger (Rome 1616)
  • Aria di sarabanda
  • Toccata in G minor
  • Partite sopra quest’aria francese detta l’Alemana
  • Toccata-corrente-gagliarda in G major (Piccinini)

Notes

Selected partite and dances from the Bologna tradition, featuring lute repertory and theorbo/chitarrone arrangements drawn from 16th–17th century sources.

item.title: Caravelle della musica
item.description: Ensemble programme blending Iberian and Italian repertoire for Renaissance consorts.

item.title: Dos peninsulas
item.description:
Dos peninsulas

Renaissance lute and Baroque guitar

Lute (Renaissance)

  • 5 Fantasie — Francesco Canova da Milano (Venezia 1546)
  • Fantasía / Pavana de Alexandre / Romanesca — Alonso de Mudarra (Sevilla 1546)
  • Toccata — Giovanni Girolamo Kapsperger (Rome 1616)

Baroque Guitar

  • Folias españolas e italianas
  • Suite in A minor
  • Preludio, Allemanda, Giga, Burlesca — Santiago de Murcia (ca. 1730)
  • Pasacalle sobre la D — Gaspar Sanz (1674)
  • Tarantella, Fandango, Canario

Notes

A dialogue between Iberian and Italian plucked-string traditions, pairing Renaissance lute works with baroque guitar repertoire.

item.title: Les musiques du Roi Soleil
item.description: Programme featuring music from the court of Louis XIV for viols and theorbo.

item.title: Tanyer de gala
item.description:
Download the original program PDF: Download PDF

Short description: Vihuela and baroque guitar.

Tanyer de gala

Vihuela and Baroque guitar

Vihuela

  • Ricercar 3 — Francesco da Milano (Intabulatura de lauto, Venice 1546)
  • Fantasia para desenvolver las manos — Alonso de Mudarra (Sevilla 1546)
  • Guardame las Vacas — Luis de Narváez (Los seis libros del Delfín, Valladolid 1538)
  • Fantasia 7 — Luis de Narváez
  • Pavana 4 — Luys Milán (El maestro, Valencia 1536)

Baroque Guitar / Chitarra

  • Preludio, Allemanda, Giga e Burlesca — Santiago de Murcia (Passacalles y obras, ca.1730)
  • Pasacalle sobre la D — Gaspar Sanz (Instrucción para sonar la guitarra, Zaragoza 1674)
  • Marionas; Folias Españolas; Fangango — Santiago de Murcia
  • Canario — Gaspar Sanz

Notes

Festive program celebrating Spanish vihuela and baroque guitar traditions with dance forms, fantasias, and virtuosic pieces.

item.title: Tres territorios
item.description:
Download the original program PDF: Download PDF

Tres territorios

Baroque guitar and Theorbo

Baroque Guitar

  • Fandango — Santiago de Murcia (Codice Saldivar ca. 1730)
  • Pavana por la D
  • Pasacalle sobre la D — Gaspar Sanz (Instrucción para sonar la guitarra, Zaragoza 1674)
  • Tarantella
  • Folias Españolas — Santiago de Murcia

Theorbo / Tiorba

  • Arpeggiatta
  • Works by Giovanni Girolamo Kapsberger (Kapsberger repertory)
  • Toccata V
  • Corrente
  • Gagliarda
  • Toccata VIII
  • Partite su l’Alemana / Partite su la Romanesca — Alessandro Piccinini

Notes

Program mixes Iberian guitar dance forms and Italian theorbo repertoire, showcasing stylistic contrasts and historical sources.

item.title: Una storia fra le corde...
item.description:
Download the original program PDF: Download PDF

Short description: Vihuela and theorbo.

Una storia fra le corde…

Vihuela and Theorbo

Vihuela

  • Fantasia para desenvolver las manos — Alonso de Mudarra (Tres libros de música en cifras para Vihuela, Sevilla 1546)
  • Fantasia del quarto tono
  • Mille Regez — Luis de Narváez (Los seis libros del Delfín, Valladolid 1538)
  • Pavana 4 — Luys Milán (El maestro, Valencia 1536)
  • Romanesca — Alonso de Mudarra (Tres libros de música en cifras para Vihuela, Sevilla 1546)
  • Fantasía I (4th Book)
  • Benedictus — Josquin
  • Soneto lombardo — Enrriquez de Valderrábano (Silva de sirenas, Valladolid 1547)
  • Bassa de contrapunto

Chitarrone / Theorbo

  • Toccata-corrente-gagliarda in G major — Alessandro Piccinini (Libro di intavolatura di Liuto et di chitarrone, Bologna 1623)
  • Toccata in G minor
  • Partite sopra quest’aria francese detta l’Alemana

Notes

Program emphasises Iberian vihuela repertoire alongside theorbo works drawn from Italian sources, forming a narrative journey through the strings.

item.title: Viaggio musicale nell'Emilia del 600'
item.description: Ensemble programme featuring instrumental works from 17th-century Emilia.

item.title: Volcania
item.description: Chamber music programme directed by leading early music specialists.
